title: Message to lower elos
body:
Accept when you've made a mistake and don't blame other people, played a game on my smurf that i just got to level 30 and holy shit the amount of people that just blame you and rage when you did absolutely nothing wrong is ridiculous, apparently i should've 2v5 with the Riven to defend our turret, sure let me just go suicide for nothing and in the end they'll still get the turret and the inhib, but worth amirite? Learn when to give up certain things, there's a reason i ended the game 15-2 and that's because i played smart and didn't go into a fight i was going to lose. Funny enough i still got raged at for carrying, i would've muted but it was amusing listening to the things they were saying.

Also, message to the idiots that say "im a smurf", don't say you're a Diamond smurf when your smurf has a 50% winrate with 522 games, it just makes you look like an idiot.

replies.body:
"apparently i should've 2v5 with the Riven to defend our turret"

Nah Riven should have been good and just penta'd 1v5 like a decent Riven.
No such thing as "good" in Silver.
I had a malph take turret aggro at an open, uncontested turret last night and he blamed me for his death because he didn't wait literally 3 seconds for the friendly creep wave....
You'll encounter these types of players a lot in the lower elos, some people are just that damn stupid.

>apparently i should've 2v5 with Riven to defend our turret

Riven could have gotten a penta with that as she's broken.
OP is bronze for playing Riven wrong.

Enemy was full health with Baron buff, i probably should've mentioned that lol.
And i wasn't the Riven, I was with a Riven.
